snippet: In a 14-1 City Council vote, the nation’s second-largest city approved an increase from $9 an hour over five years, and gave the push to raise wages across the country a major lift.
abstract: Los Angeles City Council votes 14-to-1 to raise city's minimum wage from $9 an hour to $15 an hour by 2020, giving support to labor groups nationwide trying to raise wages; some estimates say almost 50 percent of city's workforce earn less than $15 an hour.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and NOAM SCHEIBER
byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from Los Angeles, and Noam Scheiber from Washington.

lead_paragraph: In a 14-1 City Council vote, the nation’s second-largest city approved an increase from $9 an hour over five years, and gave the push to raise wages across the country a major lift.

headline.main: Los Angeles Lifts Its Minimum Wage to $15 Per Hour
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Lifts Its Minimum Wage to $15 Per Hour
